<<<<<<< HEAD
An antidote against the plague. Or Panchrestōn: a salue for all sores which applied and practised, will soone awaken the Lords mercy, and suddenly cause the storms of his iust iudgements to vanish away. Deliuered in a sermon, preached within the Cathedrall Church of Saint Paules, London. Antidote against the plague. Hastler, Thomas.
[6], 37, [3] p.
Printed by M. Flesher, London : 1615.
Dedication signed: Tho: Hastler. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Printed by M. Flesher, London : 1615.
